tool.name: Garnett - check markers
tool.description: Check marker file to filter out markers of suboptimal quality

param.name: cds_object
param.label: CDS object
param.help: CDS object with expression data for training

param.name: marker_file_path
param.label: Marker file path
param.help: File with marker genes specifying cell types. See https://cole-trapnell-lab.github.io/garnett/docs/#constructing-a-marker-file for specification of the file format

param.name: database
param.label: gene database
param.help: argument for Bioconductor AnnotationDb-class package used for converting gene IDs

param.name: cds_gene_id_type
param.label: CDS gene id type
param.help: Format of the gene IDs in your CDS object

param.name: marker_file_gene_id_type
param.label: Marker gene id type
param.help: Format of the gene IDs in your marker file

param.name: propogate_markers
param.label: propogate markers
param.help: Should markers from child nodes of a cell type be used in finding representatives of the parent type?

param.name: classifier_gene_id_type
param.label: Classifier gene ID type
param.help: The type of gene ID that will be used in the classifier. If possible for your organism, this should be 'ENSEMBL', which is the default.
